abstract: Shire’s board still has some leverage. For one, there’s AbbVie’s own weakness, because roughly 58 percent of its sales come from one drug, Neil Unmack and Robert Cyran of Reuters Breakingviews write.
snippet: Shire’s board still has some leverage. For one, there’s AbbVie’s own weakness, because roughly 58 percent of its sales come from one drug, Neil Unmack and Robert Cyran of Reuters Breakingviews write.
lead_paragraph: Shire can get more from AbbVie. Shire, the London-listed drugmaker, is pondering a fresh, $51 billion unsolicited bid from its American rival. AbbVie claims shareholder support and is offering a hefty premium, but Shire’s board can probably extract one more increase in return for its recommendation.

headline.main: Shire Can Get Higher Bid From AbbVie

byline.original: By Neil Unmack and Robert Cyran
